temberature@hypothes.is said:

how

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T05:05:35
item.description:
in reference to:

记忆：重复回忆问题；时间间隔随着回答成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 过程的流畅性：重复完成简短练习，有许多变体；时间间隔随着成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 卡片写作：重复问题、模糊的想法、主干想法，从中积累思考，时间跨度为几个月；将卡片标记为「有成果」或「无成果」，以扩大/缩小时间间隔 习惯养成：重复简短的反思卡片，可能根据顺序改变，应用于你的日常经验；间隔默认扩大，但可以放缓 阅读队列：一系列 PDF，标签页，书本，总在变换：如果一段时间内忽略某些内容，它就会暂离一周，之后是一个月；比如说「我现在读够什么了」，这东西就会几天之内再次呈现；说某个东西「不是现在读」，那就几个月，之后是几个月之后再呈现…… 电子邮件收件箱、任务队列、个人通信等

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:25:54
item.description:
in reference to:

I focused almost entirely on optimizing when I should review the material. My partner made to realize that any spaced repetition algorithm is only half of the story. The other half is how you engage with the material.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:44:26
item.description:
in reference to:

From now on, my focus on “how to learn” would be shifted from “when should I review this” to “what should I do when I indeed review this?” It’ll be about thinking frameworks and mental models; it’s about “what and how to think” instead of “when to think.”

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/vim - Has anyone ever felt like the cognitive load of using motions balances out any benefits? in the user temberature at 2022-08-13T02:34:35
item.description:
in reference to:

You are still using your head. At some point most of the things that are vim related won't be processed by your brain but by your muscle memory.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/vim - Has anyone ever felt like the cognitive load of using motions balances out any benefits? in the user temberature at 2022-08-13T02:35:35
item.description:
in reference to:

Over time you will figure out your preferred motions and work flow. You will develop muscle memory for most of it and it will be intuitive (直观) and instinctive (本能) .

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/vim - Has anyone ever felt like the cognitive load of using motions balances out any benefits? in the user temberature at 2022-08-13T02:44:45
item.description:
in reference to:

Learning to use vim really is like learning a language. You're still "translating" in your head instead of just "speaking" naturally. Just keep practicing and it will become second nature with time.

item.description:
in reference to:

此时的游牧教室，几乎变成了一层套一层的叠加小宇宙。最内层是学生的头脑。包裹着它的，是我们的对话（以及白板互动）。在这一层对话之外，是我的头脑（其中有无数可能突然才想起来的事例、材料，以及数字卡片资料）。而在我的物质身体之外是书库中无数的书架。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 教育行业已经没戏了吗？我绝不这么认为 in the user temberature at 2022-08-23T05:56:44
item.description:
in reference to:

反观美国，早在2017年就有90%的中小学实现了iPad辅助教学，纽约等州还推出了"1:1 iPad"（学生人手一台平板）的计划。此外，还有Google Chromebook这个现象级产品，仅仅2020年的发货量就达到了3000万台，其中绝大部分用于教育。在美国，大学生用Macbook、中小学生用Chromebook、大家都用iPad或Surface，早已成为司空见惯的常态。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Using Devonthink to Organize a Writing Project in the user temberature at 2022-08-30T09:05:44
item.description:
in reference to:

The software lets you make your own connections between files with tagging and grouping functionality. I tag individual files with key information relevant to the file. Devonthink can then display all files with the same tag, which means working on a particular theme becomes straightforward.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 从 Evernote 到 DEVONthink - 少数派 in the user temberature at 2022-08-30T10:30:48
item.description:
in reference to:

DEVONthink 在学术领域有着非常广阔的前景，不止可以用作 Archive 工具，也是是非常好的 research 工具。从学生的角度来看，将从 Portal 中下载下来的 PPT、PDF 等文件 Index 到 DEVONthink 中，使用 RTFD 记笔记，随后使用 See Also 从之前 Index 好的数据中检索相关信息；另外使用 DEVONthink Index Bookends 的 attachment folder，从而使用 Bookends 管理 citation、DEVONthink 做 research，都是非常吸引人的使用场景。这篇文章的 research 工作全部是在 DEVONthink 中完成的，当所有相关文件全部存入 DEVONthink 以后，搜索真是一件美好的事情。另外能够检索 Google Scholar 等数据库的 DEVONagent是无缝整合进 DEVONthink 中的，在只使用 DEVONthink 就获得了令我满意的体验情况下，我十分期待把 DEVONagent 融入工作流以后的表现。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 金融消费者如何购买 in the user temberature at 2022-08-30T15:08:35
item.description:
in reference to:

、合同条款复杂、坑多，金融机构抱怨消费者预期高、拒绝承担风险、不理智。究其原因在于，消费者自身和金融机构对于消费者的金融行为都没有认知和把握。 本书全面梳理了消费者金融行为这个重要但“冷门”的主题，话题涉及常见的金融行为，包括投资、保险、借款、储蓄、资金管理、缴税和规避欺诈，综合了各个主题最前沿的研究，并且以案例结合观点展开阐述。 本书讨论了人们金融行为的决定因素和条件，如个体差异和个性、对风险得失的理解、自信、信任、风险偏好、时间偏好、决策制定和自我调控等等，分析了针对不同的金融消费行为，这些因素是如何地影响着

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Folder Structure to Maximize Writing with Devonthink Pro — Workflows in Personal and Professional Productivity in the user temberature at 2022-09-03T14:29:11
item.description:
in reference to:

Although at one point I had all my information on manuscripts in a single DTP database, over the last year I have maintained separate databases; one for PDFs, another for my annotations.I accomplish this by having separate folders in Dropbox. After extracting my annotations from Highlights.app, I place the exported files in their own folder. Once a month, I export all the PDFs in my Paper’s Library to their own Dropbox folder. I use a Hazel script to throw away any duplicate PDFs in the Dropbox folder. I index (not import) the annotations folder into one DTP database, and index my PDFs into another.

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated (91 封私信 / 80 条消息) 石墨烯电暖产品是真的还是假的？ - 知乎 in the user temberature at 2022-11-11T17:12:14
item.description:
in reference to:

石墨烯地暖目前最大的问题在「涂层」，如果不去做好「封装」，长时间会氧化、粉化及脱落，不可能做到耐用 20 万小时。加上采用丝印工艺，两端涂布不均匀，容易产生「电阻差」，功率不到几年就衰退了，结果就是更耗电而你不自知！

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated (91 封私信 / 80 条消息) 为什么饭店的大铁锅从来都不粘锅？ - 知乎 in the user temberature at 2022-11-14T09:28:19
item.description:
in reference to:

正常饭店炒菜流程，首先预热锅，锅的温度加热到200-300度，放油，均匀涂到锅底后立即下食材，这时候油作为导热液体，迅速加热食材表面，食材表面水分剧烈沸腾，莱顿弗罗斯特效应主导，形成一层蒸汽膜，达成不粘。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Git - Git Configuration in the user temberature at 2022-11-15T04:43:42
item.description:
in reference to:

Git can handle this by auto-converting CRLF line endings into LF when you add a file to the index, and vice versa when it checks out code onto your filesystem. You can turn on this functionality with the core.autocrlf setting. If you’re on a Windows machine, set it to true — this converts LF endings into CRLF when you check out code: $ git config --global core.autocrlf true

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Git - git-config Documentation in the user temberature at 2022-11-15T05:16:38
item.description:
in reference to:

core.autocrlf Setting this variable to "true" is the same as setting the text attribute to "auto" on all files and core.eol to "crlf". Set to true if you want to have CRLF line endings in your working directory and the repository has LF line endings. This variable can be set to input, in which case no output conversion is performed.

This method answers queries in two steps: first it retrieves the information relevant to the query, then it writes an answer tailored to the question based on the retrieved information. The first step uses the Embedding API, the second step uses the Completions API.

item.description:
in reference to:

Sections should be large enough to contain enough information to answer a question; but small enough to fit one or several into the GPT-3 prompt. We find that approximately a paragraph of text is usually a good length, but you should experiment for your particular use case.

four major stages, pretraining, supervised finetuning, reward modeling, reinforcement learning, and they follow each other serially.

item.description:

You shouldn't judge the power of a model by the number of parameters that it contains.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T10:54:05
item.description:
in reference to:

The way you would do this is you would create a specific few-shot prompt that makes it look like there's some document between the human and assistant and they're exchanging information.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:02:07
item.description:
in reference to:

For example, one place where I still prefer to use a base model is in the setup where you basically have n things and you want to generate more things like it.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:08:28
item.description:
in reference to:

I think to a large extent, prompting is just making up for this cognitive difference between these two architectures like our brains here and LLM brains.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:08:59
item.description:
in reference to:

These transformers need tokens to think

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:09:42
item.description:
in reference to:

Because this conditions the transformer into showing its work and because it snaps into a mode of showing its work, is going to do less computational work per token.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:12:18
item.description:
in reference to:

if you don't ask it to check, its not going to check by itself it's just a token simulator.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:15:23
item.description:
in reference to:

LLMs don't want to succeed, they want to imitate.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:18:20
item.description:
in reference to:

You have to find the right amount of IQ.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:19:18
item.description:
in reference to:

One thing to keep in mind, again, is that these transformers by default may not know what they don't know.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated State of GPT | BRK216HFS in the user temberature at 2023-05-28T11:29:35
item.description:
in reference to:

So my recommendation right now is use LLMs in low-stakes applications. Combine them always with human oversight. Use them as a source of inspiration and suggestions and think co-pilots, instead of completely autonomous agents that are just like performing a task somewhere.
